instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the performance of the automatic BSR detection at the seedling stage, and how far can this metric go?
Output:
The metric chosen to evaluate the performance of the automatic BSR detection at the seedling stage using a pre-trained deep learning model and hyperspectral images is the F1 score. The F1 score is a measure of the model's accuracy, precision, and recall, and it provides a balanced evaluation of the detection performance. 

The F1 score can range from 0 to 1, with 1 being the best possible score. In this study, the F1 score achieved by the VGG16 model trained with the original images at 938 nm wavelength was 91.72%. This indicates that the model has a high level of accuracy, precision, and recall in detecting BSR at the seedling stage. 

Therefore, the chosen metric, the F1 score, demonstrates the effectiveness of the automatic BSR detection method using a pre-trained deep learning model and hyperspectral images.
